result.execSummary:
The defendant John M. Hanna was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay court costs.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.

9:33 a.m.  Court in session.  Defendant John M. Hanna in court with attorney Kathilynne A. Grotelueschen.  Cody John Horlacher appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is before the Court on the suppression motion that was filed by the Defense.  Discussion between Court and Attorneys concerning various issues relating to suppression motion.  Court is going to request parties file Briefs on whether testimony can be reopened at that time.  State's Brief will be due on September 4th; Defense Brief will be due on September 11th.  Court sets further motion hearing date.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant John M. Hanna in court with attorney Kathilynne A. Grotelueschen.  Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Matter in court for continuted motion hearing.  Minutes filed.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 09:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 02:30 pm.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for October 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Motion Hearing Part I on May 14, 2015 before the Honorable David M. Reddy
Court Reporter: Sandy Elderbrook
Exhibits in Court File

Court in session # 2:37 p.m. Appearances made. Defendant John M. Hanna in court with attorney Kathilynne A. Grotelueschen.  Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Matter before the Court on Defendant's Motion to Suppress. Statement by Attorney Grotelueschen that the State stipulates to disregard any statements made after defendant was placed in handcuffs. State agrees. Attorney Grotelueschen requests that the witnesses be sequestered. No objection. 
2:34 p.m. - State calls Officer Daniel Croak who is duly sworn and responds to direct exam of D.A. Necci
2:47 p.m. - Cross exam by Attorney Grotelueschen
2:54 p.m. - Defendant's exhibits 1 & 2 marked and identified (photos).
3:00 p.m. - Redirect by D.A. Necci. Witness excused @ 3:02 p.m. State rests.
3:03 p.m. - Attorney Grotelueschen calls Officer Rayfield who is duly sworn and responds to direct exam of Attorney Grotelueschen
3:16 p.m. - Cross exam by D.A. Necci
3:18 p.m. - Redirect by Attorney Grotelueschen. Attorney Grotelueschen moves exhibit 1 into evidence. Objection by D.A. Necci. Overruled - exhibit received. Attorney Grotelueschen moves Exhibit #2 into evidence. Same objection by the State - Court receives exhibit.
3:23 p.m. - Witness responds to Court's Questions.
3:23 p.m. - Cross exam by D.A. Necci. Redirect by Attorney Grotelueschen. 
Attorney Grotelueschen requests short recess to confer with her client to see if he wants to testify. Court grants request and sets matter over for continued motion hearing.
Court in recess. Minutes filed (ls)  Motion hearing scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 09:00 am.
State's Brief In Response to Defendant's Motion to Suppress

Signed bond filed with the court.

Court would allow cash bond to be converted to a $5,000 Signature Bond upon a responsible person from New Life Lodge contacting the Court and verifying that they are ready, willing and able to monitor the defendant and make sure he is complying and will also inform the Court if Mr. Hanna is no longer living there.
Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH KRISTA HINTZ. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
